thread.title: Buenos Aires Top Attractions That Should Not Be Missed
thread.title_full: Buenos Aires Top Attractions That Should Not Be Missed

author: admin
title: Buenos Aires Top Attractions That Should Not Be Missed
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > Buenos Aires Top Attractions That Should Not Be Missed Buenos Aires Top Attractions That Should Not Be Missed   21, 2015 
Buenos Aires is the cosmopolitan capital of Argentina. It is well-known for its vibrant nightlife, passionate tango and European atmosphere. There are a number of tourist attractions and therefore the Buenos Aires top attractions need to be chosen carefully. 
Buenos Aires is all about stately buildings, balconied presidential palaces, shopping plazas and busy parks and museums. 5 Buenos Aires Top Attractions 
The Buenos Aires top attractions, which should be missed during your visit are included below: La Recoleta Cemetery 
This is a labyrinthine city meant for the dead and you can spend hours at this place. The cemetery is spread over 14 acres and consists of 4691 vaults above the ground. The Argentine government has declared 94 vaults at this cemetery as National Historical Monuments and they remain under the protection of the state. Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes Photo Credits: Ministerio de Cultura de la Nación 
If you are looking for some relaxation then The Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes is the perfect place for you. This is the place that you can choose for escaping the heat in summers or for spending a cool day in winter. This museum showcases the fine art collection of Argentina and entry at this museum is free. San Telmo Photo Credits: Fabián Gómez 
This is a city with antique shops, low buildings and narrow streets. The city is rich in history and possesses a colonial flavor. The best thing about this city is its market which is called the San Telmo market. Plaza de Mayo Photo Credits: Max 
Plaza de Mayo square is one of the Buenos Aires top attractions, which came into being in the 16th century. The Presidential Palace called Casa Rosada lies at the eastern end of the square and the Cabildo, which is a Spanish town hall, lies to the opposite of Casa Rosada. La Bombonera Photo Credits: Adécio Mascarenhas 
This is a famed studio in Buenos Aires and is a perfect tourist spot for people who are fond of sports. The stadium is under the supervision of Club Atletico Boca Juniors. The stadium is used for playing soccer which is a national pastime and near-religious sport in Buenos Aires.
